content:
Welcome to Mini 1347!
Mod:
mcqueen
Back-Up Mod:
Moneybags
Reviewers:
petroleumjelly, LlamaFluff, Empking, izakthegoomba, pappums rat


Rules

Voting & Lynches
  1. Please vote in bold (
    Vote: McQueen
    ) or use the vote tags (VOTE: McQueen).
  2. Please unvote in bold (
    Unvote:
    ) or use the unvote tags (UNVOTE: ). You do not
    have to
    unvote before re-voting, but I would appreciate it if you did.
  3. A lynch will occur when more than half the players are voting for the same person.
  4. A no-lynch will occur when more than half the players are voting for no-lynch.
  5. Once I post the death scene for a player, it turns night. No posting is allowed during the night unless I specifically allow it or it is a V/LA notice.


Posting & Communications
  1. The Mod colors are
    purple
    and
    tan
    . Please do not use these colors in posts.
  2. You may PM me at any time and ask me anything (i.e. to get a rule clarification).
  3. Do not quote PMs from me, especially Role PMs.
  4. No out-of-thread-game-discussion is allowed unless I specifically allow it. Violations of this rule will result in an automatic modkill, or blacklisting if it gets to that point.
  5. Do not edit or delete any of your posts, nor use any encryption, hidden or small text, or foreign language.
  6. After you are dead, you may have one Bah post. This should not be game-related, but I do not require anything special to be included in this post.


Activity & Deadlines
  1. Each day will be about 3 weeks long.
  2. Each night will be about 72 hours long.
  3. If at any point in the game a deadline is reached, and no player has enough votes to be lynched, then there will automatically be a no-lynch.
  4. If you do not post within a 48 hour period (and have not declared a V/LA status), you will receive an in-game prod.
  5. If you do not post within a 72 hour period (and have not declared a V/LA status), you will receive an PM prod.
  6. If you do not post within 48 hours of a PM prod, you will be replaced, unless you post before I find a replacement.
  7. If you have declared V/LA, you will be exempted from a prod during that time.


Etiquette
  1. Please try to avoid vulgar language.
  2. Please do not make any personal attacks. I will not punish you if you do, but I would appreciate it if you don't.
  3. Follow the rules.
  4. Be mature.
  5. Have fun!

Setup

Mini Normal uses a 13 player Closed setup, with at least 1 of the following:
  • 1+
    Vanilla Townies


Sample Role PMs

Mod (Vanilla Townie Role PM) wrote:
Welcome,
[Player]
. You are a
Vanilla Townie
. Your goal as part of the Town is to eliminate all of the Mafia.

  • Though you have no special abilities, your voice and your vote are very powerful. Use them to your advantage.
  • You may not privately communicate with any other player while the game is in progress.
  • You win when all Mafia and all Non-Town aligned factions have been eliminated, with at least one town aligned player left alive, whether you survive to the end or not.


The game thread is here. Good luck and have fun!


Game Mechanics

  1. The flavor in this game was set up to be like a play. Note that all players have a specific Role Name, although I have not disclosed which player is which character. I will only do so when someone dies.
  2. The characters are Anastasia, Catherine, De'Shawn, Guss, Jake, John, Kluh, Moneybags (he dies), Mr. Bob, Mr. Garrett, Mr. Simmons, Ms. Hags, Peter, and Steve.
  3. Please remember that the flavor and the Role Names have nothing to do with the game, they are just there to make a good story.

On the night of April 24, 2012, a man named
Steve
was working the counter in the sports store in the mall, in a little country called Italy. Suddenly, all the alarms in the mall went off, and all but 14 people escaped, with a number of them criminals. They ran in masked, and once everyone starting running around in panic, they ducked into a nearby shop, took the masks off, and faked being helpless shoppers, scared to death by the masked men. Although, they didn't leave the mall. They blended in real good, but wouldn't exit the mall. After most people had exited the mall, they shut all the doors leading in and out of the mall, quickly ducked back into the shop, put the masks on, and came back out with loaded guns. They drugged everyone, all except a man named
Moneybags
, who wouldn't drink the poison. They threatened to kill him, if he didn't drink it in the next minute, and when the minute was up, and all the sparkly, purple liquid was still in the little cup, they shot him to death. They found he was a secret agent, who escaped the wrath of the Mafia, back in some town called MafiaScum Village. When everyone woke back up after being drugged, the -- now unmasked -- men said they were saints, and could withstand any poison, sort of like that old creep, Rasputin did, back in Russia, and told everyone that a number of the men left -- which was only 13 -- were criminals, faking being one of the helpless shoppers or clerks still trapped. They also said that the criminals created a little game, where each day, everyone could search for them, and each night, they got to kill one remaining person. The last thing they said was that the criminals had them trapped, and were forced to play the game. So everyone did.


Steve:
They've got us all trapped. How they've managed to trap us, yet stay hidden from cops and officials themselves, especially in the beautiful, yet busy and bustling country of Italy, I can't say. But we need help; they've got us trapped. They say we can kill one person everyday, and try to kill them. They also say that every night they get to kill one remaining person. Since we're trapped, we're forced to play this horrid game. We need help fast!

Steve
tried to send this video, from a video camera he somehow was able to smuggle with him into one of the shops, but no one ever received it. The criminals weren't stupid, and they didn't forget to cut off all wifi and cell phone connections, either.
Steve
was downright trapped, and was utterly forced to play the game.


Anastasia:
Oh Lord, how are we going to survive? I've got a baby on the way, so we need to get out of here fast, else one of you people will be delivering a baby. Oh Lord... why? Why, why, why?

Anastasia
was
Moneybags
' wife, although once she was drugged, she could not remember this, nor did she feel anything for his murder. She only knew she was pregnant, and had to get out of there fast, before some knucklehead had to deliver the baby for her.


Mr. Simmons:
Ma'am, please. We're going to be fine, we just need to find a way out of here. Anyone got any ideas?

Catherine:
Well, maybe we'll just have to play the game. Nothing great will come out it, but it seems that's our only real option. As much as I hate it, I'll take my chances and play.

Steve:
This woman,
Catherine
, is it, seems right about this. As much as it is stupid, as much as it is necessary for us to play the game, and get out of here. I think we should do it.

And with that,
Steve
and the other 12 remaining people decided they would play the terrible game.

The sun came up on what was a beautiful day for tourists in Italy. The weather just added to the beauty. But there were some parts of Italy that didn't wake up on the right side of the bed this morning... some places such as the mall. Alas, everyone awoke, to see 13 people -- a number of them the "saints" -- ready and prepared to play the ridiculous game.

The "saints" had went into a small restaurant at the north side of the mall the day before, where they had come out with food and beverage for everyone. They assured everyone that this was the last day that anything said could be trusted. Tomorrow, the game would start, and lies would be flying around like flies. They told everyone to eat up for the big day tomorrow, and so they did. This morning, they had gone into the same restaurant, gotten more food and beverage for everyone, and came back to the central part of the mall, where everyone else was at. They again told everyone to eat up for the big day today, although none of them held a straight face. Most of the hostages were highly suspicious of them.


Steve:
I'm not eating or drinking anything else. You said yesterday was the last day we could trust anything said. Now you expect us to trust you now?

Kluh:
Man, we're saints. We're messengers of God. You think we'd lie to you?

Ms. Hags:
As much as I respect the Holy One up there, I ain't takin' dumb risks, just 'cause y'all claim to be saints. I've learned stuff over all the years I been on this planet, and I ain't trustin' nobody from this point on, but myself. I wanna get my butt outa here. Alive.

Kluh:
Whatever, old lady. Sit there and rot, while me and my other fellow saints eat up. And when you're dead, don't be askin' us for any favors, "Oh, can you poof me back alive?" and all that crap. We ain't gonna help ya.

Ms. Hags:
Suit yourself.
[under her breath] Dumb teenagers. Thinkin' they know everything.


Steve:
Whatever, let's just get on with this.

Anastasia:
Yea, we better, before one of y'all knuckleheads gonna be deliverin' a baby. Oh, lordy!

Anyway, what follows is a bunch of very good advice that nobody is going to listen to after i flip town (if i'm lynched). I'm going to say it anyway.

1) This applies to almost everyone in the game: tunnelvision is a bad thing. I think there's some extent of this with those townies on my wagon, and less so on the monkey wagon, but in short: a lot of people are getting early reads on people, then interpreting everything that they see later from those people in a scummy light. When i say tunnelvision, i don't mean tunneling. I mean the tendency to perceive things that one's scumreads say as scummy because one already has a scumread on them. Don't do it. This advice applies to angrypidgeon and drmyshotgun above all else, but also arugula if he's town, which i'm thinking less and less.

2) The wagon on me
is mostly town.
I expect there to be 5 town and 1 scum on my wagon, right now (2 is possible, but i'll explain why i think it's unlikely). First of all, kondi/angrybirds are town, and i'm thinking drmy and techno (particularly drmy) are town more as time goes on. That leaves two people on the wagon (mcstab, arugula) who i perceive as potential scums on the wagon, but here's the reason that there probably isn't a lot of scum: compare this wagon and the monkeyman wagon.

Monkey: AngryPidgeon, Arugula, Dannflor, drmyshotgun, McStab, TeChNoWC
implosion (and this is in the order that they voted me) techno, kondi, arugula, angrypidgeon, drmyshotgun, mcstab.

Now, compare the two. It's really funny, because 5/6 of the wagon of me is made up of the old monkey wagon. I'm operating under something of an assumption that monkey is town, but if he is (and i strongly think he is the more i think about his claim), then there's really no compelling reason for scum to spontaneously jump from one mislynch that's going swimmingly to a different mislynch. Sure, another claim. But i just don't see a lot of scum doing it. Because of this, I think techno's switch in particular is a very, very strong towntell. Kondi is the only one on me who wasn't on the old wagon, dannflor is the only one on the old wagon who didn't jump on me. More than that, i think scum would be uncomfortable jumping from wagon to wagon shamelessly.

This point should be disregarded, and perhaps reversed, if monkey flips scum in the future, but i don't see that happening.

3) this goes in with the above, and it's a genuine concern of mine because i really think that if the town doesn't get this under control, it's going to go down in flames: people need to stop joining large wagons simply because they exist. drmy's vote on me is a great example of that. The monkey wagon is a great example of that. I'm not phrasing it well, though, but in short, the way that the town is playing here reminds me strongly of pick your poison 5 (a large theme). The town was ridiculously reckless, and had several mislynches go through that really should have never happened. So i guess what i really mean to say is: think twice. This ties in with the point about tunnelvision as well. I've seen a dynamic like it work before, but i really strongly doubt that it will in a game like this.

4) as the day's gone on, my nullreads have been falling into other categories. Arugula is scum; maestro is town; kondi is town. arugula, dannflor, and mcstab are my top 3 picks for scum right now. andrew should be downgraded to null at this point, just because i feel like he isn't being as active as i expect him to be as town. I'm confident that matias is town, i'm confident that kondi is town, i'm confident that techno is town. Those three are definitely, definitely town, to the point where i have very little paranoia. Slandaar is town, but there's a chance that i just think he's town because he's right on a lot of things in a town where there are way too many people on the wrong track. Angrypidgeon is also town, but if one of my townreads is wrong, it could well be him.

After MUCH searching, i have found a 3:1:9 completed game.

The town got:
-a cop
-a weak doctor, which most players consider stronger than a normal doctor due to usefulness as an investigative role
-a conditional bulletproof (bulletproof any night where they dropped the hammer the previous day)
-a jack-of-all-trades, with some pretty freakin useful abilities (tracker, roleblocker, gunsmith)

The mafia got:
-a goon
-a roleblocker
-a godfather

The SK got NK-immunity.

So let's see.
The SK could have been caught by... the cop, the JOAT roleblock, the JOAT track, the mafia roleblock, or the weak doctor. In this game, the theoretical SK could be caught by... the cop (if they aren't immune) or the mafia roleblocker (if they aren't immune), and could also be shot (if they aren't immune). If there were an SK in this game, they'd probably have one of those immunities (but probably not more) as, i think, this is typical of serial killers (the serial killer that i put in my large normal was NK-immune).

The mafia could have been caught by... the cop, the JOAT gunsmith investigation, the JOAT roleblock, the JOAT track, the weak doctor, or the SK's kill. Here, they could be caught by... the cop or the sk's kill.

And let's not forget that conditional bulletproof role, which if played well, could easily stop a nightkill by hammering scum.

Compare these two games.
You should notice a VERY FREAKING LARGE difference in the amount of town power.

Somehow I doubt I could
Also, could someone clarify what a  kingmaker situation is?

Kingmaker is a situation where one of the factions (generally used for town) is in a situation where they cannot win the game - however they are able to decide which of the other factions is able to win the game.

Common situations are seen in Werewolf+Mafia games (or any game with multiple non-town teams) and also games involving SKs.

In my specific comment above Day 4 in the 1:2:10 game could be this;

1 town, 1 SK, 2 Mafia
or
2 town, 1 SK, 1 Mafia

Depending on the power roles left, neither situation is very good for Town and, functionally, they're doomed (except, maybe in the 2nd example if they go with no lynch and both scum factions cross kill), however, they can strongly effect the outcome of which scum faction wins.

I realize this is going to contradict what I said previously but here goes:

I legitimately wanted a McStab lynch at that point of the game (when I was wall v walling him). The reason I unvoted and moved on was because I was not getting any support and was beginning to wonder if my inexperience was causing me to see things that weren't there. When asked about it, I said I was reaction testing etc, which was only partially true. I ended up listing McStab as town after my reevaluation (I honestly reread the Me/Stab ISO at least 3 times back then). The huge lack of support I was getting from other players with respect to my McStab case gave me a creeping suspicion that I was just being an idiot. Particularly, Arugula's comment about me being lucky that McStab's 85 sounded so scummy made me stop and wonder if I was just making something from nothing (and decided I probably was). I've since gained a lot more confidence in my reads. Also Techno and Matias's comments about Me and Stab looking town V town contributed to my rethink. Side note: on the topic of hindsight, Matias couldn't possibly be scum for saying the same thing that Techno had about me and Sab being Town v Town. There is no way both of Stab's buddies would swoop in and say that back to back. 20/20, etc.

So I kind of ignored McStab after that point for awhile (partly because he disappeared and partly because I was then very focused on Matias/Monkey/implosion). By the time he resurfaced I was pretty tunnel-visioned on these other players.

Yes I did switch my vote from Maestro -> McStab after implosion/Slandaar booted up his wagon primarily because Stab's posts to defend himself form implosion were obvious BS. The "you guys don't want to make me claim" bit was absurdly scummy. That was also when I began suspecting Techno because Techno's "We can't run up anymore players, claims = bad" was absurdly scum sounding.
